Module imconfig
Package imconfig

Interface ConfigFactory

  • public interface ConfigFactory
    A configuration factory is responsible of creating new instances of Config via multiple alternative sources such as URI, classpath resources, maps, and properties objects. Any new configuration object should be created using a factory.

    On building a configuration from a external resource, the builder would autodetect the resource type (usually looking at its file extension) and treat the content properly, accepting multiple formats as JSON, YAML, XML, and .properties files.

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        static ConfigFactory instance()
        Returns:
        A new configuration factory

      • merge

        Config merge​(Config base,
             Config delta)
        Create a new configuration composed of two other configurations. When the same property is present in two or more configurations, the value from the delta configuration will prevail (except when it has an empty value)

      • empty

        Config empty()
        Create a new empty configuration

        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the configuration was not loaded

      • fromPairs

        default Config fromPairs​(String... pairs)
        Create a new configuration from directly passed strings, using each two entries as a pair of key,value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the number of strings is not even

      • accordingDefinitions

        Config accordingDefinitions​(Collection<PropertyDefinition> definitions)
        Create a new empty configuration according the given property definitions

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition

      • accordingDefinitionsFromPath

        Config accordingDefinitionsFromPath​(Path path,
                                    Charset charset)
        Create a new empty configuration according the property definitions from the given path.

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition

      • accordingDefinitionsFromURI

        Config accordingDefinitionsFromURI​(URI uri,
                                   Charset charset)
        Create a new empty configuration according the property definitions from the given URI.

        You can use the schema 

        classpath:
        to reference classpath resources.

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition

      • accordingDefinitionsFromResource

        Config accordingDefinitionsFromResource​(String resource,
                                        Charset charset,
                                        ClassLoader classLoader)
        Create a new empty configuration according the property definitions from the given classpath resource.

        Defined properties will be set to their default value if it exists

        See Also:
        PropertyDefinition
